Ecclesiasticus *__04.1: Son, defraud not the poor of alms, and turn not away thy eyes from the poor.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.2: Despise not the hungry soul: and provoke not the poor in his want.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.3: Afflict not the heart of the needy, and defer not to give to him that is in distress.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.4: Reject not the petition of the afflicted: and turn not away thy face from the needy.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.5: Turn not away thy eyes from the poor for fear of anger: and leave not to them that ask of thee to curse thee behind thy back.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.6: For the prayer of him that curseth thee in the bitterness of his soul, shall be heard, for he that made him will hear him.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.7: Make thyself affable to the congregation of the poor, and humble thy soul to the ancient, and bow thy head to a great man.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.8: Bow down thy ear cheerfully to the poor, and pay what thou owest, and answer him peaceable words with mildness.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.9: Deliver him that suffereth wrong out of the hand of the proud: and be not fainthearted in thy soul.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.10: In judging be merciful to the fatherless as a father, and as a husband to their mother.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.11: And thou shalt be as the obedient son of the most High, and he will have mercy on thee more than a mother.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.12: Wisdom inspireth life into her children, and protecteth them that seek after her, and will go before them in the way of justice.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.13: And he that loveth her, loveth life: and they that watch for her, shall embrace her sweetness.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.14: They that hold her fast, shall inherit life: and whithersoever she entereth, God will give a blessing.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.15: They that serve her, shall be servants to the holy one: and God loveth them that love her.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.16: He that hearkeneth to her, shall judge nations: and he that looketh upon her, shall remain secure.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.17: If he trust to her, he shall inherit her, and his generation shall be in assurance.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.18: For she walketh with him<u>in temptation</u>, and at the first she chooseth him.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.19: She will bring upon him fear and dread and trial: and she will scourge him with the affliction of her discipline, till she try him by her laws, and trust his soul.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.20: Then she will strengthen him, and make a straight way to him, and give him joy,
Ecclesiasticus *__04.21: And will disclose her secrets to him, and will heap upon him treasures of knowledge and understanding of justice.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.22: But if he go astray, she will forsake him, and deliver him into the hands of his enemy.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.23: Son, observe the time, and fly from evil.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.24: For thy soul be not ashamed to say the truth.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.25: For there is a shame that bringeth sin, and there is a shame that bringeth glory and grace.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.26: Accept no person against thy own person, nor against thy soul a lie.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.27: Reverence not thy neighbour in his fall:
Ecclesiasticus *__04.28: And refrain not to speak in the time of salvation. Hide not thy wisdom in her beauty.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.29: For by the tongue wisdom is discerned: and understanding, and knowledge, and learning by the word of the wise, and steadfastness in the works of justice.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.30: In nowise speak against the truth, but be ashamed of the lie of thy ignorance.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.31: Be not ashamed to confess thy sins, but submit not thyself to every man for sin.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.32: Resist not against the face of the mighty, and do not strive against the stream of the river.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.33: Strive for justice for thy soul, and even unto death fight for justice, and God will overthrow thy enemies for thee.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.34: Be not hasty in thy tongue: and slack and remiss in thy works.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.35: Be not as a lion in thy house, terrifying them of thy household, and oppressing them that are under thee.
Ecclesiasticus *__04.36: Let not thy hand be stretched out to receive, and shut when thou shouldst give.
